alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 2:48PM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW AND STRONG WINDS MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN COLORADO MOUNTAINS... .A cold front moving across the mountains was bringing strong winds and considerable blowing snow along with a quick shot of heavy snow across the northern Colorado mountains this afternoon. There will be near blizzard conditions at times and road closures will be possible. The worst of the snow and winds will be past by this evening, though lighter snow and windy conditions will continue over the higher mountains overnight. Snow will decrease by late afternoon or early evening, but slick roads, lighter snow, and areas of blowing snow will continue through Sunday night. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Wind gusts of 40 to 55 mph will be common, with gusts in excess of 70 mph above timberline. * WHERE...Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range, and The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks. * WHEN...The worst conditions will be this afternoon, with gradual improvement overnight. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult, with intermittent road closures possible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility with near blizzard conditions at times, especially this afternoon.
info.instruction: Consider delaying travel until the worst conditions have passed later this evening, or tomorrow morning if possible. If you do travel, carry extra food, water and fuel along with warm clothing. Be prepared for slow travel and possible road closures. The latest road conditions and closure information for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
